episodes.title: 1551: Families
episodes.plot: While planting a seed, Mister Rogers talks about how long it takes for plants to grow and that learning to wait is important. He shows a video about how people make orange juice. In Make- Believe, Cousin Mary is planning a visit.

episodes.title: 1552: Families
episodes.plot: Mister Rogers shows a film of a bird family, and an origami artist shows how to fold paper birds. In Make-Believe, puppet couple Betty and James adopt a baby daughter. Mister Rogers says there are many different ways to be a family.

episodes.title: 1553: Families
episodes.plot: Mister Rogers visits a pediatrician to help children know what to expect during a routine check up. In Make-Believe there are plans for a cousin reunion. Mister Rogers helps children know that one thing all families have in common is love.

episodes.title: 1554: Families
episodes.plot: Robert Trow shows two puppies in the yard outside Rogers' television house. He then delivers a film of different families in the neighborhood. With the Neighborhood of Make-Believe's cousin reunion nearing, Bob Dog and Ana Platypus adopt each other as cousins.

episodes.title: 1555: Families
episodes.plot: Mister Rogers takes a field trip to Sea World to see the penguin families there. He talks about how every person in the world is different from everybody else. In the Neighborhood of Make-Believe, the cousin reunion takes place.

episodes.title: 1556: Making and Creating
episodes.plot: Mister Rogers shows a video of some of the many ways children like to play and plays at his sand table. In Make-Believe, the Trolley has a cover that makes it looks like a car. Mr. McFeely and Mister Rogers play a game of miniature golf.

episodes.title: 1557: Making and Creating
episodes.plot: Mister Rogers goes to Chef Brockett's bakery to see a neighbor make Chinese dumplings. In Make-Believe, the neighbors are creating different kinds of covers, and there's a "rocking chair horse" that flies but won't come down.

episodes.title: 1558: Making and Creating
episodes.plot: Mister Rogers talks about different kinds of things to sit on. He shows Mr. McFeely's visit to a factory where people make wooden rocking horses. In Make-Believe, there are all kinds of covers - even a mask that looks like King Friday.

episodes.title: 1559: Making and Creating
episodes.plot: Mister Rogers shows a video of kittens being born. Poet May Sarton visits. In Make-Believe, Daniel is frightened by someone in a mask. He's afraid he might grow into a big ferocious tiger. Playing is a way of thinking about our feelings.

episodes.title: 1560: Making and Creating
episodes.plot: Mister Rogers visits a new playground designed and built by adults and children together. He tries out the swings and slides. In Make-Believe, shy Daniel Tiger becomes a hero, even though he doesn't always feel brave.

episodes.title: 1561: Celebrations
episodes.plot: Mr. McFeely visits a trumpet-making factory to see how people make trumpets. In Make-Believe, there's a visiting trumpeter, and King Friday declares that an approaching comet belongs to him and decrees a week of celebrating.

episodes.title: 1562: Celebrations
episodes.plot: Mister Rogers takes a field trip to a planetarium where he sees a sky show. He and Chuck Aber play basketball in the backyard, and remind viewers that trying, not just succeeding, deserves to be celebrated.

episodes.title: 1563: Celebrations
episodes.plot: World-renowned trumpeter Wynton Marsalis visits to play with the Neighborhood trio and talk with Mister Rogers about his music. It's nighttime in Make-Believe, and Henrietta is sad because she thinks her friends have forgotten her birthday.

episodes.title: 1564: Celebrations
episodes.plot: Friday's Comet arrives in the Neighborhood of Make-Believe, bearing a note that neither King Friday nor anyone else will forget. They all go to the Museum-Go-Round for Henrietta's surprise birthday party. After the party, Henrietta is surprised to hear that Reardon is making a new opera that will air the next day.

episodes.title: 1565: A Star for Kitty Opera
episodes.plot: This Mister Rogers opera, with charming sets and costumes and an enchanted night sky, tells the story of a Kitty (Betty Aberlin) who wishes for a star of her own for her birthday. Her friends help her learn nobody can own anybody else.
